item.description:
We've reserved the Screening room at 360 State Street for another Movie Night! Come see a film for free at this great location!

RSVP's are limited to 18 due to theater size, so please only say "Yes" if you're pretty sure you can make it. (There should be NO Maybe's for this event.)

Attendees: I will also need your FULL NAME (and that of any +1) for the Concierge to let you in to the building. So please, when you RSVP, either place it in your comment or contact me (AJ) by meetup e-mail or text message.

This Events Film Is:

Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964 - 95 min - Comedy/Drama)

a Stanley Kubrick film

Starring: Peter Sellers, George C. Scott, and Sterling Hayden

IMDB Description: An insane general starts a process to nuclear holocaust that a war room of politicians and generals frantically try to stop.

Special thanks to Josh, whom recommeneded this movie and will provide the disk.  (A.J. has not seen this film yet, so despite co-hosting cannot comment other than he's anxious to finally see it due to it's classic nature.)

Event start time is 6:45 for the social portion of the evening, so you can start showing up then. But we will not start the film until 7:30 or shortly there after. Don't plan to be any later than 7:30 though.

Feel free to use the waiting list. As the date approaches I can add people on the waiting list if someone else backs out, provided you sent me your name for the concierge as a contingency.

Snacks: Bring your own Snacks and Beverages. (Just Please be careful and responsible.) Sharing is encouraged!

Getting in: Enter the building through the State Street Entrance (Between the intersections of State with Court and Chapel) and talk to the Concierge, there are instructions near the call box and a bell button on it if the door is locked. If you really have trouble, pre-movie-start time you can call AJ at 315-345-9348

Parking: There is metered street parking available near by on Orange Street and Court Street, pay until 7pm. (For now, this will be changing) If you don't mind the longer walk, some of the Yale Lots are free in the evening/weekends. (I.E. Yale lot 51 on Temple Street.) 360's Parking Garage is open to visitors for Credit Card Customers only (Last I checked $5 daily max from 5pm on Friday through Sunday), the entrance is on State Street just to the Right of the building main entrance. Other local near by businesses may have open parking, however you're on your own there.

 

Don't think I really need to say this, but: This is basically an extension of my home I'm inviting you into, there for I expect everyone will treat it with respect and not risk future events (or my lease).
item.how_to_find_us: Come to the building door, Ring the Bell Button, Concierge will Direct you. If you have more problems, call AJ at 315-345-9348.
item.name: 360 Movie: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
